root.name: Hyper Street Fighter II: The Anniversary Edition
root.description: OverviewHyper Street Fighter II: The Anniversary Edition is a fighting game developed by Capcom and released in 2003, first as a part of the Anniversary Collection and later as a stand-alone game.This special version of Street Fighter II is based on Super Street Fighter II Turbo as you can choose any incarnation of a certain character from the original Street Fighter II, Championship Edition, Hyper Fighting, Super SFII, and Super Turbo. Of course, this applies to whichever game they debuted as for example Cammy is only allowed to use Super or Super Turbo, while Sagat cannot use Street Fighter 2 : World Warrior because he wasn't playable in that game. There are certain advantages towards using a certain style like Super Turbo allowing super moves while using pre-Super styles allows more damage and more chances to get an opponent dizzy.An arcade version was also developed but was not released outside of Asia.Special FeaturesAs the game is a special, 15th anniversary edition it also included the original 1994 full length anime movie of Street Fighter II.
